TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CompareMethod extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of comparison to be used when filtering data. This enumeration is used by the `Filter` method definitions in the class that take the argument.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CompareMethod enumeration represents a comparison type for certain filtering operations.
> [!NOTE] > By default, if the filtering criteria are met, a data point is either removed or marked as empty. However, data points can be filtered even if they do not match the filtering criteria, by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator.FilterMatchedPoints%2A> property to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod EqualTo = int32(2)

Docs.summary: If the data point value is equal to the compared value, the point is filtered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod LessThan = int32(1)

Docs.summary: If the data point value is less than the compared value, the point is filtered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod LessThanOrEqualTo = int32(4)

Docs.summary: If the data point value is less than or equal to the compared value, the point is filtered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod MoreThan = int32(0)

Docs.summary: If the data point value is more than the compared value, the point is filtered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod MoreThanOrEqualTo = int32(3)

Docs.summary: If the data point value more than or equal to the compared value, the point is filtered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod NotEqualTo = int32(5)

Docs.summary: If the data point value is not equal to the compared value, the point is filtered.
